ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: when the worst of them rushed ahead,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When among them the great wretch arose,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: when their arch-criminal rose up in rage.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: when the most corrupt of them incited them (to commit evil).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When the most wicked among them stood up in defiance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: When their most wicked went forth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: When the most unfortunate of them broke forth with
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: when the most wretched of them uprose,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When the basest of them broke forth
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: when the most wicked man among them rose up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: What time the greatest wretch of them rose up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: when the most wretched of them rose up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Behold, the most wicked man among them was deputed (for impiety).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When the most wicked man among them went forth (to kill the she-camel).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: when the most wicked of them broke forth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When it followed its most wicked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When the most wretched of them was sent forth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [91:12] when the most wretched of them, whose name was Qudār, was dispatched, [when] he hastened, in order to hamstring the she-camel with their approval.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When the basest of them broke forth) when the most wretched of the folk, Qudar Ibn Salif and Masda', hamstrung the she-camel.
